alert.note: Alert for Laurel; Pulaski (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 1:39PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Laurel and central Pulaski Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 139 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Somerset Pulaski Airport, or over Somerset, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ruth and Shopville around 150 PM EDT. Dykes, Grade and Bent around 155 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mount Victory and Rockcastle Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
